intro: Saccolabiopsis viridiflora subsp. taiwaniana, commonly known as the Taiwan green-flowered sedge, is a perennial herb native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, commonly referred to as the sedge family. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests and stream sides. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, with a distinctive bluish-green coloration. The inflorescence consists of spikelets that bear small, greenish flowers, which are characteristic of the genus Saccolabiopsis.
